trans-unit.source: Represents a set of constants that are used to set properties of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants> class to set properties of a SAML assertion.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A> properties to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A> to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.
Gets the name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address.
This field is constant.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailName%2A> property when serializing SAML assertions.
The name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address.
This field is constant.
Gets a URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address.
This field is constant.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A> property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property when the subject is specified as an e-mail address.
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address.
Gets a URI that specifies that the recipient of a SAML security token should use the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
This field is constant.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A> property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.

A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token should use the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
Gets the major version of the SAML specification that <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens conform to.
This field is constant.

The combination of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> properties comprises the version of the SAML specification that <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens conform to.
The major version of the SAML specification that <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens conform to.
Always 1.
Gets the minor version of the SAML specification used by <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens.
This field is constant.
The minor version of the SAML specification.
Always 1.

The combination of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue"></xref> properties comprises the version of the SAML specification that <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens conform to.
Gets the XML namespace in which SAML assertions are defined.
This field is constant.

The XML namespace is defined in the version of the SAML specification specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> properties.
The XML namespace in which SAML assertions are defined.
The SAML namespace prefix.
This field is constant.
Gets a URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
This field is constant.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A> property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.
A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
Gets the name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as a Windows domain account.
This field is constant.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserName%2A> property when serializing SAML assertions.
The name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as a Windows domain account.
This field is constant.
Gets a URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.
This field is constant.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A> property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property when the subject is specified as a Windows domain account.
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.
